text: Beliefs aside... it gets to a point where it all boils down to mathematics and probabilities. The chance that every single story like this one (NDEs)... along with all other paranormal claims are faked is nil. There are things that we don't understand about life, nature, the universe, and existence in general... I would assume that we essentially (as a species) understand less than 1% of everything that could potentially be understood about "life". People shouldn't be so quick to judge stories such as these... the odds speak for themselves and it only goes to show that there is evidence to support that our energy continues (as all energy does) once our meat bags rot.

text: My mom miscarried twice before she had me, and then once more before she had my sister. When I looked up more interviews about this boy's story, he kept saying how his sister was one of the first people to greet him in Heaven... If I recall correctly, he and Christ were approaching the gates and when they opened, she immediately came running out to pull him into a fierce hug-- and she couldn't stop hugging him during nearly his entire visit. Call me a sap, but I was pretty much crying when I heard that. It's just such a surreal thing to picture, but so heartwarming and hopeful. Too irresistibly sweet a thought for me to just ignore... I couldn't help but imagine what they might've looked like, my two older siblings and younger one, whom I never got the chance to meet. I recall some of the names Mom said she'd thought of during her pregnancies (Chloe, Emma, Paine, Bradley, etc.) and I can't help but wonder which name theirs would've been. I don't pretend to know for a fact that God exists or that 'Heaven is for real'. I haven't set foot in any church on Sunday since middle school and I still have moments of doubt, yet I always find myself still hanging on; not so much because I feel like I have to, but because I *want* to. I want to believe and I don't think I'll ever want to let go. People can judge me by whatever stereotype they want. They can call this film propaganda all they want, too. The world's not as black and white to me, though. Any-who, "To each their own"/"Live and let live"/"What's normal for the spider is chaos for the fly" (not sure if that last one made any sense, but whateves)... I'm *still* excited that Claire and I may get to meet our three siblings someday... <3

text: Here are some clues I pieced together: 1. They weren't getting paid - the father was working for stuff, and not money. 2. They had 34 000$ in unpaid medical bills, and another 23 000$ in debts (57K in total - those figures were mentioned in the movie). 3. Their son underwent surgery during that time. 4. All the things the son mentioned could have been told to him by the parents (not going to spoil) - he didn't mention anything that other people in the hospital were doing - he should be able to if he saw everything from above, no? 5. The girl's painting - it's very easy to just say : that's him, it doesn't prove anything.   What's the most plausible conclusion here?  If you were in huge amounts of debt, that had no way of being paid off (no cash flowing in), no more credit & cash (mentioned in the movie) - and that they already extended your payment dates 2 times, and were going to bankrupt you - and coincidently, your son undergoes surgery, during which HE NEVER DIED (according to medical records), what would you do?  Now, they sold millions of books, and are getting royalties off this movie...

text: Wow, what an incredible story!  Literally; it's a story with no credibility. Yeah, that whole "out of body, seeing things" experience? What, you don't think any scientists said, "That's really abnormal and intriguing; we should investigate!"? Ehahahahayeah... Turns out when an object is placed in a spot where the patient shouldn't be able to see it, but in a perfect position to be spotted by someone floating above the scene, near death omniscience suddenly becomes about as accurate as guessing what was up there.  But what about all the other stuff he "couldn't have known"? Well let's see; is it really more likely that there is a beautiful alternate dimension (or actually just plain the sky if we want to base Christianity on what the bible actually indicates, but nobody wants that; that would make the theory not only falsifiable, but just plain false!) for which the means necessary to be transported there fly in the face of everything we understand about the connection between consciousness and the physical brain. OR is it more likely that either through straight-up feeding the kid information, unintentional signalling, or a mixture of both, the kid knew this stuff because the parents, who OBVIOUSLY would have a lot to gain by lying, gave it to him? Probably the first one.  Oh, and about the stuff he couldn't have known in particular, chances are one of the recommended videos to your right is the interview with this kid. In it, he mentions the amazing story where the dad never taught him where Jesus's "holes" were, but the kid somehow knew they were in his hands and feet. Bullshit, even religious "medical experts" will tell you the Romans didn't put the nails in people's hands. Too many muscles and cartilage and such, not enough bone; gravity would rip the nails out; if Jesus was even a real person who got crucified, they were through his wrists. Maybe the dad isn't lying when he says he never told the kid about the crucifixion, but this family was clearly religious beforehand, and at very least the dad is an idiot for thinking the kid has gone whatever number of years in the Christian culture without seeing and being influenced by at least one faulty image of Jesus on the cross. Actually, I guess that's a pretty damn likely explanation that the dad has cement for brains if he was blown away by the kid telling him the granddad was called pop-pop. I've heard some weird names, but I'm gonna go out on a limb and say that that was NOT the grandfather's first name. A grandfather who has been addressed as pop-pop, what are the odds?  And you know what? You're right, if I'm an atheist and I don't like this stuff, I shouldn't click on it. Unfortunately, only the first premise is true. I don't hate this stuff. Well maybe I do on the most superficial level, but I do get enjoyment out of watching these. You see I have a rather grim sense of humor, and if you're on the outside of the freak-show looking in, religion is some of the best dark comedy to ever exist.  Knock knock. Who's there? No one, but because the vast majority of people seem to be under the impression that there is someone there, manipulators and exploitationists and charlatans are going to keep getting rich by selling this brain-dead schlock to the masses, and most of them are going to go to their graves, sometimes prematurely due to their delusion, without ever knowing how badly they were robbed.

text: Some people are afraid to die because not everybody is going to Heaven. Heaven is a place ONLY for those who accepted Jesus Christ as their personal Lord & Savior. The Bible says "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life. -John 3:16"   And for those who don't believe and reject Christ will automatically bound to HELL where there's lake of fire and  smoke of their torment goes up forever and ever and they have no rest day and night”.  (Matthew 13:41,50; Revelation 20:11-15; 21:8; Revelation 14:11).  HEAVEN is for real & as well as HELL. They are NOT fairytales. ( Read Daniel 12:2,3; Matthew 25:46; John 5:28; Revelation 20:14,15).  It's a fact everyone dies. But no one knows when you'll die. And wen you do, you better be sure where you're heading.. Heaven or Hell? The facts are right in front your face. No one will force your stone-cold heart to believe all these facts. People are like "to see is to believe", that's why God is already touching some people like Colton in the movie (this movie is based on a true story fyi) to tell the people what he saw..that heaven is for REAL!!  Just when you're swimming in the lake of fire, you cannot say the gospel didn't reach you. IT DID REACH YOU! There's the BIBLE to guide you, and pray for enlightenment if you're confuse and don't understand anything about heaven and hell.   Don't leave earth without SALVATION.

text: Sooo u guys mad or nah?
Sooo u guys mad or nah?

Here's the thing about NDEs that atheists don't seem to understand.  You can't just say "That was just a brain based hallucination" and consider the issue settled.  If something is a brain based hallucination then it should be able to be proven by science.  And by "proven" I mean something a little more convincing than just saying "the brain shows a burst of activity after great trauma" or something general like that.  If scientists were tracking the brain activity of a person that is near death, and that person managed to survive, scientists should be able to say specifically what that person experienced.  (ie "You walked down a tunnel towards the light, saw your deceased Uncle Joe and your former pet fluffy, then you were introduced to your long lost sibling that you never knew you had, etc, etc.")  Until something like this is done, the issue is unsettled, and as long as it is unsettled, there is reason to believe experiences like this truly are journeys to the other side.

text: Well, I must admit that, when I made my previous comments I made about this film, I made a hasty judgment without having actually watched the whole trailer and just kind of acted in reflex. But now that I actually have taken the time to watch it, I have to say that my reaction is even worse now. I don't know when I've ever seen such overt and tactless emotional manipulation in any film, ever. But...if that's what the masses want- and this appears to be the case- let's crank it out, boys. Seriously, I don't know what the hell is wrong with Americans and their film viewing habits that they don't feel entertained unless they're being emotionally manipulated in some really blatant, superficial fashion. It's unbelievable. The whole concept of subtlety and finesse, or even just plain realism, is like sunlight to a vampire when it comes to the average American film watcher, or so you would think when you see something like this. What the fuck is this nonsense? You're delivering your "deep" message about human immortality to the sound of a blaring cymbal crescendo? Seriously? Man...SERIOUSLY...you think I'm that easily manipulated that I'm going to buy into whatever nonsense I see on-screen because it's accompanied by loud music and theatrical fervor? Where's the fucking STORY, man? And by "story", I don't mean something more about the Judeo-Christian yoke we've been slavishly toiling under for over 2,000 years now, okay? I mean like something NEW, man...get it? No, I'm sure you don't, and you apparently won't any time soon, either. Never mind...

text: Christians complain about atheists "shitting all over other people's religions" when Christians have been doing just that for centuries to this very day, to this very minute.  As for the kid, he didn't really go to heaven because he never died.  Furthermore, heaven sounds exactly like his father the pastor probably described it to him... and you can bet Daddy was there to help him "clarify" his experiences to him.  As for belief in "Hell", that's laughable because Hell is even MORE pagan than Christmas is.  Hell is a combination of Niflheim and Tartarus with the name of the Norse goddess, Hel, slapped on it.  There is nothing in the Bible about it.  The Jewish people, whose religion the Christians *stole* and warped into a monstrosity, don't even believe in it.  Hel, most of what Christians know about Hell comes from Dante's Inferno of the Divine Comedy, a FICTIONAL STORY.  Not like mythology isn't fiction to begin with, but we're talking about something that has the same legitimacy of SHAKESPEARE.

text: I read the book before the movie came out. The more I read the more I wanted to know in detail about Colton's experience. I couldn't stop reading, and at times I felt my heart beating so fast that I had to put the book down and let my eyes release some tears. At 12 years of age my parents and I had a car accident. I survived the car accident but God decided to take mom and dad with him. The book describes a lot of things and in some part I had tears of joy to know EXACTLY what my loving mother and dear father are now experiencing in Heaven.  I've always been a believer and my faith just got stronger after I read the book.   One night when I was living in California I was told something in my sleep but I couldn't figure out the meaning of what I had seen. It was kinda bothering me not knowing what I had seen.  While reading the book at a starbucks in Denver, Colorado something in the book described what I was told and what I had seen in my sleep. I had to put the book down...I was shaking and my eyes just filled up with tears. What Colton described  in his book while he was in Heaven everything was matching EXACTLY what I had seen in my sleep. I was truly shaking.  I just can't wait for that day to come… what he revealed me in my sleep, and truly I can't wait to see my mother and father again.  You know, we are all children of God. He loves us ALL, it doesn't matter who YOU are. He loves us ALL unconditionally. He created us with his love, to be loved, to spread love. I want to see the movie… but I recommend reading the book first. YOU WILL BE MOVED… the end is just will just get you even more excited and fill you up with joy. Read the whole book, God is truly AMAZING. God Bless us ALL.

text: Having read and 'studied many NDE's (near death experiences) this movie is only portraying one. There are literally thousands (if not more) people who have experienced NDE's. They don't necesarily have the same experiences. There are certain aspects of it that is similar but varies due to people's different beliefs and realities. Consciousness lives on forever (so you never die). So in this specific NDE where he experienced his unborn sister, his grandfather, seeing what his father and mother were doing are all true. His Jesus experience was because of his religious belief. People will experience what they believe to be true ( religious beliefs will encounter religious deities whether that is Jesus, Allah, Mohammed, Buddah etc). Consciousness creates. Thoughts, perceptions, emotions creates your reality. There are various 'death' stages which follows greater insight and understanding (having a 360 degree view). So the 'God concept' changes as to believing in a separate God or a no God to a knowing of the concept of God as 'All That Is' which includes you, me, us and everything.

text: This movie is actually based on a true story, as it shows in the book the actual boy who had his experience. So, no. We did not just slap "based on a true story" onto it and expect people to believe. We are giving people a chance to think about a situation like this, giving them a chance to truly see whether they like the idea of a god or if they don't believe. So, yes you have the choice whether to like this movie or not. You also have a right to have your freedom of speech. However, this does not give you the right to completely try and rip apart a Christian with your rudely stated logic. Simply stated, Christians also try to tear down a view from atheists. This does not mean all Christians are bad, nor are all atheists are bad. The fact that several atheists felt the need to comment with foul language, and rude statements, without thinking through a simple question a Christian could give an actual logical answer to, sickens me. This is a movie based on a child's belief of what he saw, as he is not forcing you to believe. You do not have to belittle him just because you felt the need to rudely share your opinion. To those of you who politely stated your belief, left it simply, and then left it alone, are the ones who are deserving of anyone's respect. Yelling at a Christian for something you do not believe in won't change their faith, so there is no reason for you to try and belittle them. Same as for Christians. Some do try to force their belief on others, those are the ones who do not necessarily need your respect. People are different, and that's what it comes down to. You don't have to use the will of freedom of speech to be a completely rude and irrational person. Use it to simply state your polite opinion and leave it at that. It's that simple. Thank you to those who took the time to read this carefully and understand the fact you don't have to be rude to state an opinion.

text: PROOF THAT GOD EXISTS:  1But of the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that I write unto you. 2For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night. 3For when they shall say, Peace and safety; then sudden destruction cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall not escape. 4But ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should overtake you as a thief. 5Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we are not of the night, nor of darkness. 6Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober. 7For they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night. 8But let us, who are of the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of salvation. 9For God hath not appointed us to wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord Jesus Christ, 10Who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him. 11Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do. 12And we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you; 13And to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. And be at peace among yourselves. 14Now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort the feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men. 15See that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men. 16Rejoice evermore. 17Pray without ceasing. 18In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you. 19Quench not the Spirit. 20Despise not prophesyings. 21Prove all things; hold fast that which is good. 22Abstain from all appearance of evil. 23And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. 24Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it. 25Brethren, pray for us. 26Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss. 27I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren. 28The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

text: For every belief you have, make sure that it can be backed up with the Bible. When man dies, he goes into the grave. He shall stay there until the Lord's second advent. Many Christians have the belief that when a love ones die, they go to Heaven. This however is not biblical. It would be nice if humans could determine such, but only God determines (for which I am glad) who goes into Heaven and since He has not returned, none has. There are references of those who have gone, such as Moses and Elijah.  Satan uses a mixture of truth and lies to get his way, and sad to say this is one such. If the movie has been viewed by anyone here, state which of the following statements made by the little boy would not be known by the Devil? This is not a hate/anger message, hence I did not press the dislike button. The truth is in the Bible and many people will soon see the light (I know many will refuse to believe as well).  Eccl 9:5 For the living know that they shall die: but the dead know not any thing, neither have they any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.  The dead speaking to the living is spiritualism. This has been recorded in the Bible with King Saul speaking to a dead Samuel through the Witch of Endor. It is known that it was not Samuel but the Devil. 1 Sam 28 tells the story.   I pray that those who belief in the Bible will read and look into it. God bless.

text: Just my thought on this: Colten saw heaven, therefore he believed in it. I haven't seen heaven, but I believe in it. We don't have see something to know it exists. And God is everywhere, though we may not see him all the time, he is still there. Colten said that from his experience, he learned that heaven in real. I have really been thinking about the definition of faith: believing in something you haven't seen, because of what you have seen. I look at this world, from the perspective of a 15 year old girl, a 9 year old Christian (I came to christ when I was 6). Ever since I was 6, every time I look at the world as beautiful, I think, "Wow! Just imagine how beautiful heaven is if the world isn't as beautiful!" Now call me stupid or whatever comes to your mind when you read this, but just my opinion. I may get a lot thrown back at me for writing this, but just my thoughts and beliefs about Christianity.   Faith: believing in what is unseen, because of what is seen

text: I'm an atheist, but that doesn't mean I don't think this movie is unappealing. I would love to watch this movie not for religion purposes, but just for the happiness this kid gives to the people around him. Everyone brings up religion all the time, but lots of people are different, everyone is different, we believe in different things and we judge each other or disrespect what others think or why they think it. I believe that something happens after we die, we can't just go into nothingness for eternity, I do believe in a Heaven, and I do believe in a Hell, and a in between, I don't have to believe in a God to think that. This is what the movie is about, it's just about a young boy, who saw things, and how he uses that to change the lives of everyone around him. So what if the family does believe in God, that doesn't mean it qualifies as a "Christian Movie" though it is rated as one. I would love to watch any Christian Movie because other people's beliefs is fascinating to me, as long as they aren't shoving it down my throat because I don't believe in the same thing as them. I understand what people believe in and why, but that doesn't mean I have to agree with them.

author: Who Iz Dizzz???

text: Wow.. the reviews here and on the IMDB page are shocking. This is a religious-based movie that is marketed towards Christians. If you were expecting it to be non-"preachy" then you aren't very smart, are you? This is an amazing story about Colton Burpo's experiences in Heaven and his family and friends' struggle to believe him. Everyone wants a "rational" explanation for everything, when sometimes, there IS no "rational" explanation. I researched Colton's story quite thoroughly after I saw it, and the fact that he knew his mom had a miscarriage (at 4, when NO ONE told him or discussed it around him) is testament to what he saw.  On a side note, I often find it quite funny that those who are so quick to believe there are aliens out there but are just as quick to discredit God and the afterlife.
author: Troo Kidd

text: What really disappoints me about this movie is that the pastor doesn't preach the Bible. Not only that but when he was confused,he sought man's wisdom instead of God's. Then there was the fact that there was no mention of hell and that people actually go there. Where was the gospel of Jesus? Where was the repentance? That is not the church of Christ in that movie. It's the church of feelings and emotions.  It was all about people. I'm not attacking the little boy or his story. I'm upset that they portrayed God as if He were not sovereign or holy. Yes,real people go through what those people went through but they were told lies,not the gospel. Not to mention the idolatry. It was far from biblical.

text: I'll like to state my opinion, I hope no one tries to lash me or anything, because I respect everyone's opinion. I believe in God and I believe that he sent his only son to die in the cross for our sins. I recently got baptized, because ever since I accepted Jesus into my life, my life has changed for the best. First of all to me GOD is not a religion, he's a relationship. All these fights about this and that and divisions of different "Religions" when there in only one God. People like to stretch the bible and make up their own versions of what happened and they just completely misinterpret the whole thing. That is exactly what the Devil wants you to think. He wants to confuse you and for you to see God as this big monster. I pray that God illuminates people's minds and that God places strong people in their lives to help them realize the truth and for them to stop with such negative comments towards something that is so amazing, which is the love of Jesus Christ.   One thing people need to know is that God does not force anyone to invite him into their lives. He loves you either way. You have the right to live your life the way you want too and invite him if you want. If you don't invite him, then that is your problem not Gods. The reason there is so many bad things happening in the world and the innocent are dying is because people don't let God in, and God is not going to enter any where if he's not accepted. There are a lot of people world wide who worship objects, they find a weird image in a tree and they start worshiping that tree, or they worship other God's and saints, and the evil just lurks around and bad, crazy stuff happens and God punishes. If you don't let God in, the Devil will be wondering around lives and the lives of the innocent. That is why there are people out there sharing the gossip world wide and into those tribes who worship other Gods. Its up to them if they want to let God in, if not then the evil will continue doing his thing in people's lives.  One very good example is violence in schools, God is not even allowed to be talked about or mentioned in schools, so this is why so many crazy unthinkable things happen in schools and people are to stubborn to realize it. The bible was written so people around the world can know what happened, for those to share the word of God to those who don't know. BTW this earth was created so perfectly. Think about the seasons, how flowers bloom etc.. and it does not make sense to me that it was created the way scientist say it was. lol monkeys to humans...  Some people just have the wrong idea about who God is, hes all about love, but if you don't believe and want to live your life all crazy with lies, fornication, adultery, living your life getting high and drunk, hurting others, being greedy and thinking yourself better then others and all that bad stuff, your life ain't going to go very good.  God is such a merciful God that he has hope and faith in non believers, that's why he has not come yet and taking those who are worthy to be in heaven, but there will be a time when people will realize that all this is not BS and he will deny you.  Matthew 10:33 But everyone who denies me here on earth, I will also deny before my Father in heaven.  This is not a fantasy this is life deal with it...

(as stated in the bible).  You have no pure good intentions at ALL to see/feel his presence. . has revealed himself to me, and may i say he is real. It is more of a spiritual feeling rather than hard core "evidence" which you will never understand.   If God revealed himself to the whole world, then no one would have a true meaning of believing in God. text: Hello, everyone! ^u^ Usually I try my best to keep from the youtube comments...but I had to let you all know just how amazing, beautiful, and wonderful each of you are-whether you're christian or not, all of you are making me nervous just being around you- that's how amazing you are! ^.^ I'm not sure if I'll make it to heaven or not, and lately I've been praying that no matter if I make it there or not I'll never grow to hate someone so precious to me, Jesus! :-D I've been praying that I'll never grow to resent those who do make it there without me, because to me they're special in my heart. I heard stories of how people who didn't get to heaven, hated those that did, and Jesus even more...but I pray with all my might, that that'll not be the case! But that when I see that they made it, I hope I'll have peace and be overjoyed :-) To everyone, atheists and christians alike...I wanted to share my knowledge with you!  To the christians, I've learned the hard way that you must learn the word for yourself, that's wonderful if people inspired you to learn more about the bible, and encourage you to read scriptures-but those people may not always be around to remind you or inspire you, people may not always be around to pray with you everday-or those people may even forget themselves that they need to pray. You have so many resources around you that there's hardly any more excuses left for not taking action to read it yourself except for if you haven't heard of the lord, or if you lose those resources...and even if you do lose the resources you once had, look above! :-D God is still there smiling and looking down on you, if you ask for even the smallest scripture, he'd be overjoyed and would give you a thousand more  scriptures than what you asked for! Think, if God has been with you for all these years, even when you haven't paid him a lot of attention, surely he won't leave now that you've brought him into your life again! Without learning the word, your chances of heaven start to grow slim, because then you are open to all kinds of deception. Have you ever heard of 'The Sinners Prayer'? After a lot of shows on TBN (Trinity Broadcasting Network) near the end, after they say the prayer, the preacher will say "If you just  said that prayer, and believe just got born again, get into a good bible-based church, make Jesus your lord and savior and he'll take you places you've never been!" or something along those lines, and this is true! :-) Except, what they forget to mention is that you must be BAPTISED as well as believing in him and making him your lord and savior.   A little, one-sentence scripture a day is enough!  Think on that scripture, and pray about it! If somebody says or does sommething that you don't think is right, look it up in the topical bible (Just google search it  and it should pop right up! :-D) and see for yourself! Look up youtube videos about God to get you more rooted in the lord, but first learn the bible well- or else you may even be decieved then!   If people who don't believe in god know more about the bible than you do, and you know at least some of those people are using the word for the wrong reasons, then it's time to make a change! If non-believers are pulling out all kinds of scriptures out of books in the bible that you haven't even heard of, in an ARGUMENT, you must at least want to try to do something to change that! Please, it'll save your life! :') I want to see each and everyone of you succeed.  You start with any book you want, Genesis or Revelation, just try it and be diligent! Remember that standing up for God proves just how fearfully and wonderfully made you truly are, and it will be rewarded!  But if you only do this when you feel up for it, in a time when you feel as if you're forced to stand up for him, this isn't enough. Do it everyday! Do it with a hairflip, then walk away with your head high, and if you got on heels clack em' real hard against the ground when you walk away- and if someone looks at you funny, smile and show them allllll of your teeth! XD (But if I showed them MY chipped yellow teeth, they might start running u.u) be proud when you stand up for the lord and it won't go unnoticed!  Live the word you read, and use it as your weapon! Christians, you are beautiful, and special, and all kinds of amazing to me :-D I admire you all for how brave and confident you each are, I wish so badly that each of you have a place in heaven!   and to non-believers, the ones who research the bible, and to the people who don't...your just as wonderful too! You guys are amazing, and breathtaking, and beautiful, you guys are shining so bright that I'm about to pass out from thinking about the beauty you all have! But please, give Jesus a try...he won't dissapoint. I wish I can tell you that your journey with him will be easy, I want to ensure you that there won't be nights where you'll almost lose your hope in him, but the truth is there will be countless times where your faith will be tested so much to the point where it feels as if it's hanging on a thread, it may take years but he will reward you in ubelieveable ways just for hanging on so long, this I can ensure. Keep in mind that your faith doesn't have to be hanging on a string unless you make it out to be this way, if you stay deeply rooted in the word-your troubles will roll right off your shoulder and the light will come shining through again.   But...I can't force you to do anything though, just know that if you ever change your mind, all the resources you need are there. Please, for all those wanting to know about Christ...or are at all any type of curious, keep in mind that you are gradually running out of time to this :-( I'm so sorry about this urgency, I really am... but you can't put this off any longer. But, take these words to heart.... I would love to see you all in heaven, oh boy! :D In heaven I would give you all the biggest and tightest hug I've ever given! Know that your amazing, and incredible. Know that so many people admire each and every single one of you, and to these people you are treasured dearly. But your biggest admirer of them all,   is Jesus Christ.  Repent from your sins daily and have Jesus living inside you. Read the word and live it, act on what God wants you to do, and most importantly. In all things have love, not a forced love, or a reluctant love, but a genuine love for the world and all people in it, save the highest place in your life for Jesus. Remember that Jesus is the only way to God, and that all good things come from him.
author: Francis Bonnefoy

Then we have in plain language when you read the old testament that God punished Abrahams decedents from the servant girl Hagar side(Ishmael), because Abraham slept with the servant girl instead and bore her a child, Ishmael, instead of his wife. He didn’t have faith that his wife, Sarah, would bare him a child so God punished the descendents of Ishmael-Genesis 16:11-12 says decedents of Ishmael will be like a wild donkey and his hand will be against every man. God did love Ishamael but because of Abraham’s sin Ishmael’s descendants were cursed. 2 Corinthians11:14 says Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light!  Quoting from the Hadith of Bukari, 9.111: MUHAMMAD SAID, "THE ANGEL CAUGHT ME AND PRESSED ME SO HARD THAT I COULD NOT BEAR IT ANY MORE." text: That's true : heaven is real, I have seen it. Last week I have been hit by a bus and I miraculously survived, but during the time I was in a coma, I rise into the air, above the earth and into space, until I reached heaven. Then I saw god. He appeared in a golden light, between the clouds, surrounded by angels. I only was surpised that he showed himself as a giant lobster. I asked him : "Are you the only one true god ?", he said "Yes, man, I am the only one true only one god. You might not recognize me, only few animist tribes in mauritania belives in me. I am very disappointed in you, humans, yall invented so many bullshit gods and thought the earth was created for you. I created earth for my people : lobsters ! Stop thinking you're hot shit, huh. Anyway, you have been a good guy, eated pasta all your life 'cause you were too poor, so you never touched some seafood. To be accepted in heaven, you'll have to tell all humans they must believe in me.", I replied "Eh, but you know, how do you want me to do that ? We're such a bunch of shitheads.", He yelled "And tell them to stop eating seafood, godammit !". And then I woke up.

text: People talking about evidence of god all around us. I have yet to see it, and I'm really beginning to wonder just what the hell you mean by evidence. If you mean evidence in that everything you see is automatically evidence of a god, then why are you so against evolution and the big bang theory, and science in general? Both religion and science come to the conclusion that we exist, the Earth and everything on it exists, yet you believe some man in the sky did it but are completely close-minded to the alternative that science provides.  Your only "proof" is the Bible, which can be interpreted in so many different ways, your own people can't decide which way is right and your Bible gets revised. Science and scientific theory are a constant, we judge things based on the evidence before us, and change it according to newfound evidence, and the Earth is decidedly billions of years old. That fact alone should be enough to disprove your Bible.

text: Theres lots of questions that we cant just answer in a youtube comment. But everything that is happening is part of His plan, yes even the suffering. There's a difference between trials and tempations. Trials, what God does, make us stronger while temptations, what the devil does, is meant to make us fail. Events in our life fall under one of those two catagories which we dont know unless we live through it. And God chose not to take away the suffering in the world, not that He cant, so we can chose to live through them and be with God or not. And Adam eating the apple was his own choice, not Gods. He lets us have our own say and will in life. Theres so much I cant explain cuz I could write a whole essay on this topic but technical problems like the flood and such shouldn't change anything. Just google or ask a real pastor, not a priest from a catholic church, about it.

text: John 3:16. For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life. 17 For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him. 18 Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe stands condemned already because they have not believed in the name of God’s one and only Son. 19 This is the verdict: Light has come into the world, but people loved darkness instead of light because their deeds were evil. 20 Everyone who does evil hates the light, and will not come into the light for fear that their deeds will be exposed. 21 But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that it may be seen plainly that what they have done has been done in the sight of God.   You must be born again in order to have a real spiritual relationship with Jesus. It is not a 'religion' it is about living a lifestyle the best you can, that will glorify & please The Lord. Not even the Christian who attends church every Sunday and prays so many times a day is perfect. We were born into sin. God is perfect, so there was a barrier between us and God. Jesus died on the cross so we are cleansed & forgiven for our sins from yesterday, today and tomorrow. Meaning that when we accept Jesus & invite him into out hearts, we can have a real relationship with God, pursue the wonderful plans he has for each of our lives & go on to live with him in heaven for eternity. God, His son jesus, & the Holy Spirit are 3 in one. When we have jesus in our hearts his Holy Spirit helps us to make wise choices & discerns what is right and wrong. Sure we still get things wrong, as we are not perfect, but God is an unconditional loving Father, who always welcomes us to come home to him no matter what.

text: If you guys wonder why Atheists such as myself watch these kinds of movies, well my friends, it's called entertainment. I also love watching/reading Harry Potter but it doesn't mean I believe in magic now does it? ;) Now there are different kinds of atheists just like there are different kinds of Christians. Some are assholes, and just don't give a fuck about opinions, while others and understanding and open to any possibility. I've read the bible, I enjoy it as a book, which what it is to me. The story is interesting. It doesn't mean I have to dig deeper into it. The concept of a "God" or a creator is astounding, no doubt. And the idea of a heaven and hell, well that's ying and yang for you right? What im saying is that if you weren't raised by Christian families  and whatnot or had any influence then would you still believe? Because if you had no one to tell you of "God", how would you know of him? I was raised by a mixed Christian/ Mormon / catholic household and I'm still atheist, but how can this be? Yet i have respect for those with religion. And keep in mind no one introduced atheism to me. And you cannot say I'm close minded because I just showed partly that I am not.

text: After reading quite a few comments, I'm really surprised at some commenters. It's like a huge argument between atheists and Christians, with a couple of neutral people on the side. I'd like to be one of the neutrals. Personally, I have no idea if this story is true. Yes, I believe in God, the bible, and heaven. No, I don't know if you can go to heaven and come back or who will go to heaven or not. Those are all my opinions. It's my choice what I believe. Reading some of the ruder things in the comments, a few thoughts were going through my head. One was "Why do the Christians tell nonbelievers that they're going to a not-so-pleasant place?" Out of curiosity, I ask how you got this information. I don't think it's in the scriptures, but if it is, please tell me. I don't pretend to know who will and who will not go to heaven, but I'm fairly certain it depends on a person's actions throughout life, not a comment on a YouTube video. But that's just my opinion. Another thought, "Why do the atheists insist on being angry at the Christians for believing in heavenly beings?" If you think science has not proven it and therefore it's not true, fine. It's not my place to tell you what you should believe or think. But why spit upon those who do? I think (emphasis on think) most of you live in America. Correct me if I'm wrong. In America, it specifically says in the constitution that we have freedom of religion. You can choose what to believe, which I'm thankful for. But you don't have to force your beliefs on anyone else. Finally, the last big thought, "Why post negative things?" I'll take a line from Bambi and say if you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all. It's like (and this is a terrible comparison) DC fans posting on a Marvel video just to complain about Marvel and what they think is stupid. Marvel fans do the same to DC videos, I'm sure. Why can't you just let others enjoy what they enjoy without saying negative or hurtful things? Lastly, thanks to all those who commented simply to talk about the video. I really liked those comments, because some were even from atheists and Christians alike who just had an opinion of the movie, not just about the truthfulness of the story. I might see the movie myself, because it looks interesting. (Fyi, I don't mean to complain. My comments are, let's say, constructive criticism (because my 6th grade teacher loved that term))

Maybe spirituality, religion, and the science behind the mind are trying to tell its own version of the same thing; a grand conscious truth.

text: GREG: (Greg Smith, Founder of Agile Writers of Richmond, VA) Scott, I m in seventh heaven over this week s film.  SCOTT: (Dr. Scott Allison, Professor of Psychology, University of Richmond) Heaven can wait, Greg. Let s get on with the review.  GREG: Our story opens on Pastor Todd Burpo (Greg Kinnear) who is working odd jobs trying to make enough income to take care of his family. His income as the pastor to a small flock in Imperial, Nebraska is not covering their expenses. He lives a simple life filled with softball games, friends, and his family consisting of his wife Sonja (Kelly Reilly) and two small children including four-year-old Colton (Connor Corum). Things are going pretty well when something dreadful happens. It s any parent s worst nightmare.  SCOTT: Colton has a ruptured appendix and has emergency surgery performed on him. He survives, but it was a close call. Maybe a bit too close. In the weeks and months that follow the surgery, Colton begins revealing memories of visiting heaven while he was unconscious. At first, Todd has trouble coming to grips with these recollections, and then when word gets out the entire congregation becomes stirred up.  GREG: The young man who plays Colton is just adorable as the four-year-old who reflects the innocence of youth. There is a scene where Colton is visiting a sick man in the hospital and Colton sees a child suffering from chemotherapy treatments. He walks over to the child and holds her hand and reassures her that nobody s going to hurt her. Scott, this movie is based upon the real events documented in the book by the same name. The subtitle of the book is A Little Boy s Astounding Story of His Trip to Heaven and Back. The fact, however, is that this is the story of Todd Burpo s experiences and trials after revealing his son s visions to the world. This makes Burpo the hero of the story. Greg Kinnear does a good job of making Burpo look like an everyman with the world on his shoulders.  SCOTT: Greg, I enjoyed the concept of this movie, as I m fascinated by near-death occurrences and all the common experiences that people worldwide have shared when they ve come close to dying or have died and come back. I read the book and found it to be a powerful account of a young boy s claim that he visited heaven. I say powerful because if you believe the father s account, there are three compelling pieces of evidence supporting the boy s story: (1) the boy s knowledge of his unborn sister, (2) the boy s knowledge of the grandfather he never met, and (3) the boy s confirmation of the image of Jesus as portrayed by a Lithuanian girl who also had a near-death experience. But the movie-makers decided that this story alone wasn t powerful enough to carry the movie. So they decided to make the father the hero and to manufacture a good deal of anguish in the poor man. He s depicted as a hothead who kicks furniture and who struggles with the idea that his son has met Jesus. None of this happens in the book, and for good reason - it s a silly notion for the father, a Christian pastor, to disbelieve his son s story that heaven exists. The movie also fabricates a terrible crisis in the church over the veracity and meaning of the boy s story. These embellishments rang false for me.  GREG: I didn t read the book and you ve pretty much summed up my problems with the story. It wasn t about the boy, it was about the father. This tack follows a typical Christian pattern wherein the hero of the story (Pastor Burpo) reveals his belief in miracles and the faithful (despite their beliefs) reject him. This creates a martyr of the pastor and he must face ridicule and the wrath of his followers. But through his own faith and tenacity he convinces the un-faithful to follow and believe. It is a story that seems familiar to me from reading the Bible.  SCOTT: There really are no villains in this story, but there are oppositional forces that our hero, Todd, encounters. There is a woman on the church board who wants to replace Todd. There is a psychotherapist who preaches a scientific explanation to Todd when he instead needs spiritual guidance. There are also his own inner demons and difficult circumstances, including dire family finances and numerous personal health setbacks. Again, many of the struggles that Todd faces do not appear in the book, which wisely centers on the sheer power of Colton s story rather than on reactions to the story. So we have a movie that tells a powerful story of a visit to heaven but strangely focuses on everyone getting wigged out by the story.  GREG: Id have to differ with you there, Scott. The congregation of Burpos church are the villains. Or should I say opposition . There is no evil intent here. But they create the hardship that Burpo must work against. Truly, if there were no oppositional force in the movie, there would be little story. I think we ve seen this story before. Do you remember the classic film Oh, God? In that film John Denver plays a man who talks to God and the entire world including family and friends turn against him. It s only his faith that sees him through the challenge. There are a couple of classic Christian film tropes in store for the viewer. Burpo makes a trip to a college professor who is an expert in out of body experiences. She is a non-believer and has recently lost her husband to cancer and is bitter and hates God for it. We saw this same character played to the extreme in God s Not Dead.  SCOTT: Heaven is For Real is an unconventional movie that puts all its emotional eggs in a single spiritual basket, namely, the afterlife experience of a young boy that seems to defy belief. The movie makes the unfortunate decision to showcase the father s turbulent journey rather than the child s, and the result is a film that doesn t ring true to me. There are good performances by the entire cast, and as you note, Greg, Connor Corum is adorable as the young Colton. But I cannot give this movie more than 2 Reels out of 5. Greg Kinnear does a fine job in his role as Todd, but the hero journey lacks both heft and believability. I found Todd to be one of the least spiritual people I ve seen in the movies, and yet he is a Christian pastor. Toward the end, he and his wife finally see the light, but why it takes 90 minutes to see such a bright light is beyond me. I can only give Todd 2 Heroes out of 5. While I wouldn t call any of the characters villains per se, there were oppositional forces that force Todd to squirm, to suffer, and to change. One could argue that this movie is a nice story of a family that prevails over serious financial, health, and spiritual setbacks. Still, some of these obstacles, such as the congregation that freaks out, seem forced and fabricated. For that reason, I can only give this film 2 Villains out of 5. Movie: Hero: Villain:   GREG: Scott, you pretty much read my mind. Heaven is for Real is a movie that preaches to the choir. If you re a believer you ll believe. If you re a doubting Thomas, you won t be convinced. I give the film 2 out of 5 Reels. The hero is a simple confection of a good man in a difficult situation. Other films have dealt with this topic in a more convincing fashion with a more humble and sympathetic hero. I give Burpo just 2 out of 5 Heroes. And the congregation as the villains were predictable and flat. They rate just 2 Villains out of 5. Heaven is for Real won t get many revisits. Movie: Hero: Villain:

text: So the god most people believe in died on a cross to save humanity of sin   So if we don't believe, we are punished for not believing in something we never saw?  Of all the religions out there, we are told that *this* is the right one.  We are brought on to believe that god is so good. What about the innocent people who die? Can you *justify* death by "God's will"? We are brought into this world with a purpose. Getting to the point where you can provide for yourself, get a proper education, and gain intelligence. Sure, you could say "just because you've never seen him doesn't mean he isn't real" but with everything going on, knowing that he *let* it all happen, what excuse is there left? I believe that there is someone out there, because science cannot create science when before the world, science was nothing.

text: Hi everyone. Long long before this movie came out I was a teenager in the early 1980s. My parents brought me into a old antique store on the Oregon coast. I was bored "like always with anything old" so ..I looked around so no one was watching me I pulled out a glass in a box wrapped in a news paper printed printed in 1912. I read a article that a woman was in sugury and that her spirit had lived out of her body....and was hovering over head watching the sugouns performing surgery on her. I was shocked....WOW I am looking around ...no one saw me so quickly wrapped the news paper around the glass and put it back into the box. I said to my self.....this is REAL! not made up! people in that erra were MUCH more honest then today and the stories of ghost were real! since then I have joined a few near death experience groups interviewed no less then 50 members and the stories they say are astounding! not every NDE is the same but the detailed are incredible. Small example: when a person dies and has a NDE the silver cord...cord of life is attached from the body to the soul. It glistens and it needs to stay attacked both to the body and soul in order to return back to the body. If its severed...the soul can never come back to the body. The soul also travels at t he speed of thought...lighting quick. I could go into more detail but the stories I have read are astounding. Ohhh.and try and do the right thing! you ma see you self in a "life review" of your life in the afterlife doing thing that are painful to others.

text: Y'all from the movie of Heaven is for real, the movie is great, but the lady who said "Heaven and Hell are just concepts to frighten people" How can you, you who said that Heaven and Hell are just concepts say that they are just concepts, they are not concepts they are real. Y'all people don't know the truth, y'all are just trying to make a show in church. Let me the tell y'all a few things. #1.Heaven and Hell are NOT concepts to frighten people, Heaven and Hell exist, but those 2 Kingdoms cannot be seen just like Jesus Christ cannot be seen. #2. The Reverend or pastor of the Church in the beginning of the movie, you said that your not sure if Heaven is real, how can you, preaching the Word of God not believe in Heaven. #3. The Rapture of the bridegroom do y'all believe in that? (See the following scriptures that talk about the Rapture: 1Thessalonians 4:17, 1Thessalonians 4:16, 1 Corinthians 15:52, Luke 17:34-37, 1 Corinthians 15:51-53, Matthew 24:31, Matthew 25: 1- 46 and Luke 17:35-37) because I do and it will happen before Jesus Christ comes riding on the clouds of Heaven #4. When the Reverend or pastor fell to the floor, wife Sonya Burpo of the Reverend or pastor, your not supposed to tell your friend "that lady that said that Heaven and Hell are just concepts to frighten people, your not supposed to tell her sing Amazing Grace, NO! On the contrary your supposed to have the whole Church pray with faith for your husband, not sing Amazing Grace, Why you going to sing Amazing Grace for when your husband is on the floor with his back hurting? #5. If y'all don't seek for the Holy Spirit in y'all's Church, you should do so.  #6. Pastor/Reverend Todd Burpo, what does the story of the lion, bear, unicorn and Tiger have to do with the Word of God?  #7. in this movie your supposed to preach the Word of God  #8. In the hospital scene Todd Burpo, how can you being a Reverend or a pastor yell at God telling him "Don't you take my son", No! you're not supposed to get angry at God, get angry at the Devil he's the one who put the sickness in your son. Or you don't believe in Hell and the Devil who is in Hell? Just like there is such thing as Jesus Christ, there is such thing as the Devil. You supposed to remain in Faith Todd Burpo, not yell at God. But other than that the movie was great it really inspired me

text: I’m probably gonna get hate for this but that’s what the comments section is all about. I have a problem with these kind of “miracle” movies. They themselves are pretty mediocre movies and are really only created to push a religious agenda forward to people who aren’t sure of their position religion is (which is really bloody exploitive) and just gives people who are already religious what they want to hear slowly shutting them off to other viewpoints. It’s just propaganda (not like Nazi propaganda but like join the navy kind of propaganda). They even all have the same exact format. Someone is nearly close to death and some people pray, boom, magic, he’s saved! It’s a miracle! Look, you can belief whatever ridiculous crap you want but when talking to someone about it discuss it respectfully rather than do all of this movie cliche that makes it look like more of joke than it already is.

text: You guys do realize this is all completely made up right?   Alex, now 16, revealed that the detail in the book was false. “I said I went to heaven because I thought it would get me attention,” he wrote on his own blog. “I did not die. I did not go to heaven. When I made the claims, I had never read the Bible. People have profited from lies, and continue to. They should read the Bible, which is enough,” Alex wrote.  Don’t take my word for it, do a google search for yourself if you like. Believe in whatever you want to, but stop letting these people lie to you and profit off of your blind faith.
author: Handled Scandal
